reviewText:
I know this game is from 2008, so it's going to seem like I'm picking on it a little bit.
Aesthetically, it's a game with big, although not pretty skyboxes. The game is so unashamed to use invisible walls that it becomes massively obvious where the level designer wanted you to go. Gameplay wise, it's your standard First person shooter, with lots of knee high walls, your default squishy human, hard wearing mythical creatures and tank-like minotaurs, but most enemies except for the minotaurs could be taken down in a few well placed shots. The story concept had mileage to go, but somehow this game really didn't do it justice, either they've had to cut the campaign and story down for financial reasons, or from publisher deadlines, but if I'm honest, I don't care. The ending left me feeling like it'd just cut the wettest of farts and left. It has so many bad story cliches, that if it had any more, I'd have thought I were in a printing mill.

As for the voice acting, I don't know whether they used someone's fake english accent, or they just found some seriously stuck-up lady, but the accent sounded so unbelievably indignant throughout the game, even when you had to save her, not to mention the drawn-out exposition. Hey, I get it lady, I need to go to these three doohickeys and blow them up to shut down the watchamacakllit before time rund out and it goes off... What's that lady, oh, you want to explain it for the extra special soldiers in the room? Sure, it's not like the world is ending and we're on the clock.

It still has potential for a sequel or DLC levels if they had left out that deus ex machina ending, but sadly, what has been done can not be undone.

reviewText: I played this game for a bit, I really tried to like it. It has a lot going for it, a fun story (if cliche), pretty great graphics for an indie  dev, and some decent sound design. However, it is so, so painfully linear. You'll be walking through a large area, say a city, apartment complex, sewer, etc., and there is only one path. So every door is closed or blocked off except for the ONE you have to find. The enemies are pretty cool but very monotonous. You'll go through a very redundant, linear path, blasting the same baddie over and over again. As others mention, it's real buggy. It's one of those that have a lot of potential, could be a really fun corny B-grade game, but it just falls short.

reviewText: It got some bad press but it's still a hell of a ride. It feels more like you're in Cloverfield than anything, constantly navigating through crowded cityscapes while they're being destroyed from giant monsters. The game's poorly viewed because it's on more rails than a Disneyland ride, but I realized that this was the best way to see this game: as not much of one. Instead, enjoy the chaos around you as you hold down the W key and look around with your mouse. There are smaller enemies to fight, but nothing taxing. The 3D's showing it's age, so even on maxed out settings the poly modeling and animations just aren't that great. But Legendary makes up for these deficiencies in sheer spectacle...and a $2.50 price tag when I took the plunge.

reviewText:
Paid $50 on launch. Completely Disapointed.
The game is unpolished in every sense of the word, Weapons feel powerless, Sound design is the exact same Loud echo pop gunshots that COD: WAW and the dev's previous game Turning Point: Fall of Liberty use. Animations are somewhat bearable, but below the standard for late 2008 even.  Scripted events often fail to impress, or assume the player is in a location he might not be in. It was kinda fun-ish. Not Half-life 2 fun. Not even playing tennis or a sport outside fun. But it was fun to overcome the game's challenges which were mostly based on poor design and not actual challenge.

Which brings me to the reccomendation.

For 74 cents or even $4.99 It's worth it to try it out. You might kinda sorta have fun. Having paid $50 I forced myself to wade through the terrible emotionless main character, the tedious scripted events, all of it. And It wasn't worth $50 at all. But If it was launched as a budget title for only 19.99 on launch, then dropped to 15, 10, then 5, it would have been far more forgivable. They realized this and it's 1/10th the price when it's not on sale. or typically 3/4th of a dollar when on sale. That is amazing. Spark Unlimited won me back with Lost Planet 3, and even though Legendary isn't nearly a good game, it's worth your chance for three quarters.

reviewText:
A legendary disaster!
- Very low quality textures
- No physics
- Unnatural movements
- No smoothness on mouse pointer
- One, and only one, available path. And it is very well delimited by walls, rocks, humans that block the way, and so on. Pathetic...
- Stupid monsters. They are not characterized and you just have to use much or less bullets to kill them. And if bullets are not sufficient, take a rocket. Easy, isn't?
- The Pandora's box looks like the Arc of Alliance. If you say so...
- If this is a storyline... It seems that it was scriptured by a children of 4 or 5 years.
- You WON'T BE ABLE to complete the game, because of a ridiculous bug on the ending part, when you enter in a lift. No comment...
- The character can run only for a second. After that, he is already tired. Whooooaaa.... Oh, and it jumps like a dump. He can make a 1 km jump when running, and a 1 cm jump when not running. Incredible!!!

In the end, DO NOT BUY this game, unless someone is pointing a gun at you. Well, in that case, your life is better, so buy it!

reviewText:
Legendary, it's a fun little game (although rather short), that doesn't need a good rig to run (looking at the specs), but I just can't recommend it:

Pros:

+ Enemies spawn a lot
+ Graphics are decent
+ Okay voice acting
+ Cool powers
+ Combat/Gunplay is alright

Cons:

- There's not much of storyline
- Only a small amount of enemies (2-3)
- Forgettable people
- AI can be really dumb
- Only 2 real uses for the power
- Barriers galore
- Really buggy
- Can glitch up on you at times
- Miniscule amount of weapons at your disposal
- Little to no replay value

Overall, 4/10, whilst I enjoyed it, it just wasn't for me, too many negatives.

reviewText: Legendary, I saw the screens and video for this game and they looked totally awesome, then this game went on sale for what looked like a ridiculousness low amount. It wasn't... I can't help but be mixed up about this game. All the selling points are there in the game but then you run into the execution of the game itself what look like minor flaws turn into major ones that are dampening the game experience. The game looks sweet, no denying that but you main character seems to walk dragging his feet. Little things on the ground that even real people in life would just step over trap you in this game. As far as the jump button in this game, the developers went for reality's life real jump as in the character can only jump about a foot and a half. That makes jumping redundant in this game, anything waist level... your not getting over and anything knee level looks like you could just walk over then you get stuck saying 'really? I gotta jump that?'. It's this flawed gameplay that keeps Legendary from being a 'Legendary Game'. I'm keeping this game just because it looks so sweet and has awesome looking enemies but the gameplay is bad enough that until I'm bored with nothing else to do, only then do I fire up Legendary. This game by all rights should be an awesome game then someone turned around and glued the main character's feet to the ground and made navigating a simple room a maze of unmovable minor things. Recommending this game? No but at least I don't hate it enough to say they should of never made it...

well this game is pure sh***************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************t. The story is worse than a fu***** twilight book, dont believe me? Then buy this game and see for yourself. The game begins with you, the main character (well no sh**) opening Pandora's box in the worlds lowest security museum. After opening said box , an army of super â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ Griffins ( *Gryphons if you cant spell properely) spawn in from the skies and kill everything for no reason. As the onslaught of the Griffins continues the crowd of people waiting to get slaughtered begin to scream. DO NOT USE MOTHERF****** HEADPHONES . My left ear drum has now stopped working which is awful for me as my right ear drum bled out watching Pacific Rim at the cinema. So by playing this very poor excuse for a money grab atte-*cough* video game you will more than likely become def and will then be left with negative brain cells due to the horrible voice acting, I also forgot how to read and write so my gran helped me write this review.

reviewText: What blows me away in the game industry is the time, effort, and dedication teams make to their craft. Oftentimes, it seems that teams who are so passionate about their projects for some reason or another just miss the mark. This is one of those occasions. The dev diaries, trailers, promotional materials all made this game seem extremely promising. Pandora's Box is opened and mythical creatures from Greek myths roam the lands in modern-day New York (I think?). Sounds cool, sounds fun, sounds fresh" as the marketing and branding teams wants you to think.\n\nDo not
recommended: purchase this game. This goes on the "why do I own this?" list of my collection. This shooter came out in the aftermath of a shooting rennaisance - Halo

reviewText:
Oh god, oh god, theres a whole subculture of them - Oh Gosh 10/10

Ive played some linear FPSs in my time but this could literally be rebranded as a tightrope simulator if you took the guns out. Talking of guns its a case of all bark no bite and the same can be said about the foes you face.
Just like a hollywood blockbuster, the idea had potential yet ended up with all the best stuff in the trailers.

Ok its easier to do best of than pros and cons so here goes,

For the award of best worst game ive ever played, i now give you Legendary

And theres be thinking you couldnt get worse than playing 5 hours of kane and lynch, wonders never cease.

It had promise, it had potential but sadly it had a lack of creativity and ambition to.

reviewText: I got Legendary when it came out on Xbox and I thought it was a neat game. I would even go as far as to say decent. Its definitely not as good as it could have, as it should have been. The game has a decent soundtrack and the gameplay is there even if it is rough around the edges.  I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a really cheap game, this is especially true during sale times.  Get if for the single player if you do, as multiplayer is dead. Otherwise just have fun.

reviewText: I may be a bit biased as I've never heard of this game, but it's very poorly optimized. When water would spray from a pipe or fire hydrant the game would stutter, even on explosions the game would stutter. You have limited running which makes no sense as you basically gain super human powers right at the start of the game.\n\nEven on Hard difficulty the game is a joke, you can probably use the fireaxe melee that you get early on to beat the complete game. Had to quit due to headaches from the choppiness and non-smooth AI movement.

reviewText: So I bought this game for 74 cents which i thought was a steal. And as soon as i played it , it had a problem with loading the textures, which was resolved by just restarting the game. Well anyways, the basic game setup was good, fighting mythical creatures, but the game lacked so much potential it could have had. Basically a corridor shooter cause there is hardly any room to explore anything. And collecting the data PDA's was basically pointless. If you're trying to find a game to waste time on and this is less than 1$, you should buy it. Otherwise, bad choice purchasing this.

reviewText: Good idea, bad execution. I was excited to play this game as I thought that it looked very interesting and to be a good game. I loved the idea of what this game was about, and it would've been a good game, but it was poorly made. A crappy fps with bad game mechanics and some poor graphics, but the graphics were as to expect from a game from 2008. The use of the healing and psy(?) powers did not work well for me, and I don't know if this was a problem only I was having, but for most of the game when I needed to, I could not heal. So I died, a lot. The walking speed is too slow in my opinion and for having a very short running period, so it's tedious to move around. (Jumping sucks too). But, the game still has it's fun moments. Just most of the moments are just tedious or not too exiting. It is an okay" game

reviewText:
I had this game back when I was a Xbox 360 user, and I remember it being pretty good and solid.
Whoever did the PC port/version needs to be disembowled though.

The game is visually unplayable. The textures are all gone. Everything is so, so, so bare. If you've ever used Zbrush, the characters are ALL that shade of grey, and so is the rest of the level.
Particles are horrid. Flames are just red blocks.

It isn't a problem on my end either. This game really is a visually dead port. Which is a shame, as I really liked it when I'd played the console version.

reviewText: Not enough bad to be 'so bad it's good'. Just a dull shooter with loose controls and tight corridors. If things were vice versa it'd be on-par with most shooters around and story would be like icing on the cake. If there was a story...\nBut... It is ugly, boring, sub-par FPS that make your ears bleed. Though it won't frustrate you in any way. Promising on paper, it only can get you bored to sleep. Enjoy you collection of fps cliches, sir.

poorly executed game and the name is by far too promising.

reviewText: I don't know if I'd call this a recommendation" but this games wasn't as bad as I'd heard. I was always into mythology when I was a kid so the concept was fascinating to me.  The good parts are the story
date: which isn't bad and there are a nice variety of levels to play around in. It's short which means I can finish it and move on (which I did) The bad parts is a lot of everything else. The game is extremely linear until you come across an environmental puzzle and your next move isn't always clear. The guns feel extremely underpowered (it's actually better to use an axe in the early part of the game). And the worst sin of all: Hold [E] to bypass and/or turn.  There are so many valves to turn and control panels to bypass you could easily have taken another hour of play time off.  Overall did I hate it? No. But if you can get this game for a buck
recommended: which I think it has been
hoursPlayed: you'll definitely get your $$$ worth. I got this in a Groupees bundle and I finished this game
voteText: which is more than I can say than about 75% of the games I;ve gotten in bundles."

reviewText: This is actually a very good game. It has good visuals, good music, and good gameplay. The pacing is alright and the bosses are fun. The one thing which stood out to me was that they did a great job with the weapons. They all seem relevant, even the melee weapon which I used up til the last level. The story, while not fabulously original, was told and executed very well. Overall, if the game isn't quite legendary, it's a fun play and worth the very reasonable price tag.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I feel like this game's store page gives the wrong impression. With the solid 5/10 meta score and the low price of $5 it's easy to assume this game isn't worth your time but it definitely deserves a look. By no means is it a blockbuster triple A title but what it is is a short fun FPS with innovative ideas and an intriguing story. Don't buy it if the slightest bit of repetitive gameplay annoys you or else the limited different types of enemies and needing to hold E for every door might get you down but if you're out of a game to play and like a little First Person action then pick this up. If it goes on sale then you have no excuse not to!\n\nIn short - Buy it and love it for what it is, a short fun FPS to fill in the gaps.

There are way more cons then there are pros to help it stand out, leaving you with a game that pretty much falls flat on it's face!\n\nThis certenly isn't the number one worst game out there at all, but it also not one you should pay full price for. In the end  though, you might want to get this game anyway just to see how a potentailly good game idea, can go really bad.

reviewText:
Decent.

Bought it cheap on Halloween Sale.

Story: Decent. Some points are predictable, but it keeps you going. A good author could novelize the game into something much better.
Graphics: Decent. Grayscaled Unreal Engine 3.
Creatures: Good. I enjoyed reading the description on the in-game protagonist PDA. They researched their monsters.
Gameplay: Decent. Mildly repetitive & linear. The introduction of new monsters every little while makes it intresting.

There is a glitch in the final level of the game that can be fixed manually by use text editor to edit one of the game's files. That sucked!

If you catch it on sale, it's worth a few hours of play. The hate it receives is too much.

reviewText:
Legendary is a game where you play as a guy called Deckard. I don't remember his full name so I just called him Deckard Cain and you work with the Good Illuminati against the Bad Illuminati. Neither of the sides are actually called the Illuminati but â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ that â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ do you expect me to remember their actual names?

The game is mostly a forgettable FPS with difficulty that goes all over the place (seriously why the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is it easier to fight a bunch of werewolves and a minotaur than a bunch of Bad Illuminati stooges with â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ guns). However one moment has scarred me for life. During a later part in the game, you see a giant squid destroying the Big Ben. The idea of destroying the Big Ben, the tower that tells the people of England what Bong it is, is an act worse than Pearl Harbor, 9/11 and the Holocaust.

Overall, I think England should nuke Olympus since Pandoras Box  is from Greek Mythology. Besides the Greek Pantheon are a bunch of homosexual old men (and women) whereas Norse Mythology is full of badass â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥s. Like Thor.

Vote for Thorman in 2016. He will nuke Olympus and possibly Japan.

reviewText: I know the second you saw this you were confused. Legendary a good game?!?!? But I am being serious here. I loved this game. Everyone says either It is pretty moderate for a shooter" or "Bad game"  which I don't understand at all. I had more fun with this shooter than COD! In COD you fight a bunch of similair stupid â™¥â™¥â™¥ enemies who have no special abilities at all. Or you play an average zombie survival mode. Or you play online agains't a bunch of screaming kids and swearing adults with absolutely no innovation at all even in the sequels it is almost exactly the same. What happens in Legendary? Griffins swoop down picking up enemies in their mouths and eating them. Werewolfs lunge at you and throw objects at you and when they are killed you have to chop of their heads or they recuperate. Fire drakes shoot fire out of their mouths at you but can be taken care of by activating a sprinkler or shooting a fire extinguisher. And while you are doing this a MASSIVE golem above is smashing through buildings and stepping on fleeing people. Also a giant tentacled beast is grabbing allies and pulling them to a watery grave. And guess what. Those tentacles can also grab you and the golem can also step on you. All these mythical creatures from different cultures are trying to kill you while you are trying to destroy a golem by activating 3 EMPs to seperate the energy of the golem from the body. Explosive spiders from Japan
date: Fire Drakes from old tales and a Kraken from common folklore. My favourite creature is the Nari. A creepy bat like creature with a childs face who can become a ghost and              a physical creature. They often possess objects and throw them at you and generally make life a pain. They steal objects needed for objectives and force you to chase them down often leading you to traps. One time a Nari stole a valve I needed to proceed and dropped it in a suspicious looking chamber. When I entered the doors closed and a fan possessed by the Nari  started sucking me towards it. Only by shooting the supports could I barely escape and when I did I was attacked by a tentacle and almost pulled towards my doom. And that is only level 2. The only bad thing I would say about this game is the graphics however because of the graphics it works on less powerful computers like mine. Some of the most popular games also have bad graphics like HL2 and Killing Floor but noone complains about that. All in all I would give it an 8/10. Definitely worth playing and fun."

reviewText: Jan 8, 2013: This game has a promising premise, but it is plagued with flaws. Even on my good computer, I get frame-rate drops to near-crashes.. What a shame really.\nAside from that, it makes me sort've remember playing Half-Life 2 in some ways. Not much else to say about it since the issue with the drops has stopped me from playing, for the most part.\nUPDATE, Sep 19, 2014: So, after pretty much ignoring this title in my list and letting it rot, I'm finally giving it a whirl again and would believe it took a massive, ridiculous upgrade past the requirements to get this to work better? 24 gigs of ram and a GeForce GT 740 -- there's still some clipping here and there, but overall the framerate drops are less dramatic, making this game playable. I've also tested disabling HID compliant devices in the device panel, which seemed to help. For anyone looking to get this sucker working, I would recommend the HID compliant items be disabled first. That may have been the issue from the getgo.

The game is mostly a forgettable FPS with difficulty that goes all over the place (seriously why the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is it easier to fight a bunch of werewolves and a minotaur than a bunch of Bad Illuminati stooges with â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ guns). However one moment has scarred me for life. During a later part in the game, you see a giant squid destroying the Big Ben. The idea of destroying the Big Ben, the tower that tells the people of England what Bong it is, is an act worse than Pearl Harbor, 9/11 and the Holocaust.

Overall, I think England should nuke Olympus since Pandoras Box  is from Greek Mythology. Besides the Greek Pantheon are a bunch of homosexual old men (and women) whereas Norse Mythology is full of badass â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥s. Like Thor.

Vote for Thorman in 2016. He will nuke Olympus and possibly Japan.

reviewText: Jan 8, 2013: This game has a promising premise, but it is plagued with flaws. Even on my good computer, I get frame-rate drops to near-crashes.. What a shame really.\nAside from that, it makes me sort've remember playing Half-Life 2 in some ways. Not much else to say about it since the issue with the drops has stopped me from playing, for the most part.\nUPDATE, Sep 19, 2014: So, after pretty much ignoring this title in my list and letting it rot, I'm finally giving it a whirl again and would believe it took a massive, ridiculous upgrade past the requirements to get this to work better? 24 gigs of ram and a GeForce GT 740 -- there's still some clipping here and there, but overall the framerate drops are less dramatic, making this game playable. I've also tested disabling HID compliant devices in the device panel, which seemed to help. For anyone looking to get this sucker working, I would recommend the HID compliant items be disabled first. That may have been the issue from the getgo.

reviewText: Firstly, there's a bug on the final level requiring you to rewrite the ingame code limiting your max FPS to 30, just to get to the final boss.\nSecondly, everything is pregenerated, and not completely random i.e. spawns, certain interactions and checkpointed events.\nMechanicly speaking, it's a decent game, but not worth the full price.  No replay value at all, and feels too repetitive. If you want a similar game to this with a higher replay value, I would recommend Darkness 2.  This game lacks way too many things to be any good, like in depth character development, decent story plot (in a game like this that's kind of important) has random difficulty scaling at times. All around one time play through value and that's it.

reviewText:
Legendary. The game that *tried* to look like it was going to be open world.

This game was a complete disgrace and I wish I never dropped 2 bucks on this crap. The tutoial, understandingly linear even felt like it was acting like a open world game.

With the 19 (really about 12 minutes) I played of this game felt like hours. I got out of the tutorial; only for more open world (not really; but we made it look like it), it plays a cutscene. And another cutscene.

Anyway; outside of it's not open world gameplay, You get meteoker voice acting, Bad writing, Linear as hell gameplay, Bad levels, etc. Just,  Not fun.  The story goes you are in some museum, you put your hand in Pandora's box"
date:
and OH HEY THIS THING IS MAGIC. Now you have magic powers as the museum begins collapsing and various myths start popping out (You know; this could EASILY become a ghostbusters game at this point) and you have to run to the metro then in which case you have to make this jump (that you have to figure out how to cross yourself) THEN keep running to the metro while miracoulously NOT being murdered by these things while cars are being flung at various people closing   and all open world opprotunities [/b]  for that level. Then; you get into the metro and the SAME CRAP HAPPENS. At which point I decided to stop playing.

Had the game captured me better I would feel good about playing the rest.


The final rating for this game as I see it is about a 20/10. It has a great idea for a game; but horribly made."

reviewText:
The protagonist Charles Decard opens Pandora's Box, unaware of its nature, unleashing all kinds of mythological creatures rampaging throughout the world. Decard has to kill the monsters from various myths and save the world.

This has been a very pleasant surprise for me. The story is very cliche really and the game could do with a bit of polish. The sceneries and pacing however really make this game. In the beginning a great golem made from cars and wreckage roams through NYC, destroying everything in its path. Later Decard has to defeat a giant Kraken in London.

The campaign is quite short, only around 7 hours, but that is a good thing: The developers didn't reuse and repeat the sceneries over and over. Instead I always had the feeling of actually going forward, something other arguably better games like Doom 3 did not manage.

For the price the game is definetively recommended.

reviewText:
I wanted to like this game. I really tried. But I can't. Sorry.

The thing that made me play are these monsters. You don't see them much in video games these days. But the game has nothing to go for. Even the story was dissapointing.

Good things about the game+ Okay Graphics (Early Unreal 3)
+ Really nice creature designs (Exept the werewolfs. They look a bit bland.)
+ Decent Soundtrack
+ Quick to play trough.
+ Hey, it's $3.

Bad things about the game- Uninteresting Story
- Very, very bland characters
- Very, very, very linear gameplay design.
- Wonky physics.
- Awfull voice-acting.
- Cheap deaths.
- Out of engine cut-scenes.
- Some UI design is horrible.
- The shooting is sh*t. (A bit like the shooting in Mirrors Edge, but then the entire game)
- THE WEREWOLFS. They keep on spawning and its so irritating. Also, the're pretty bland.
- The ending. Wich I won't spoil. But it's lackluster. Trust me.
- Did nothing to keep me playing.
- ELEVATOR BUG

No, I do not recommend this game. But if you want to try it out, buy it. Its cheap. Like, REALLY CHEAP. And it shows.

Thanks for reading trough this review. May Gaben be with you. (Joking)

reviewText:
Don't expect a tripleA title when purchasing this game. But in fact, it's not that bad as long as you don't compare it to other, major FPS franchises.

The storyline is interesting, diverse maps, many different enemys that require a unique approach, Weapons feel ok.

As a time waster it's pretty tolerable, and in fact it does nothing especially good, but also there are no major cons...

If you look for a cheap and average FPS-experience where you don't have to think much, this is the game for you.

For all others: Better avoid it, it isn't a masterpiece and the game doesn't show anything new or does something particularly good, but it's a solid apocalypse-themed FPS with ok-ish graphics and average, CoD-like singleplayer gameplay.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
6/10 GOOD GAME BUT EASILY FORGETTABLE

Legendary was released in 2008 during a time where the FPS genre was ran by the likes of call of duty,bioshock.halo,fear,red faction and games of the like so naturally the gameplay isnt too far off
from those. it lacks variety and depth both in story and gameplay but on the flip side the visuals and
frame rate are pretty amazing for their time. the game had clunky irresponisve controls which didnt
make a big difference alot of the time but there were times (like during the minotar and griffin fights)
were snappier controls would have been helpful but werent there so movements and actions had
to be pre planned and not done on the fly. overall this game is definitly worth a playthough with a few
things in mind:
- dont take it too seriously
- dont try and compare it to modern games
- put it on easy,kick your feet up and enjoy the
games nice visuals and loose story.

reviewText:
Alright, finally picked this up on sale for about three quesrters.

Even with me dieing a couple of times here and there and that silly elevator glitch towards the end. It only took me approximately 4.9 hours to complete it.

The story was unique, i personally liked the modern era with the mythical creatures, etc. There are only a few weapons in game and you can only carry two at a time. I found myself running around with the rocket launcher whenever i was able to get my hands on it just to handle the gryphins from time to time :)

The graphics are dated compared to modern times but still stand apart and there are noticible bugs, such as you cant jump and move forward over a obstacle you have to run then jump far away not to get stuck. I also found myself constantly getting cought around corners or whatever was laying around the level. Lets not forget the final level elevator glitch, I fell through that sucker about four times before i searched for a solution. It didnt ruin my play experience but i did find it tedious.

For as short as it was I enjoyed it.

reviewText:
The game breaks from the CoD mass, using a JC2/FC2 like weapon system (managed by the directional pad on a controller, as a posed to a 2 weapon switch + inventory). Levels open up as you progress, atmosphere can swing from dark, highlighted coridors and sewers to bright courtyards in a church/cathedral, and the dusty, vehicle and debris filled streets of New York. The weapon list may be a short one, but each weapon has it's advantages over another, without filling your arsonal with random â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. Beign a console to PC port it doesn't take much to run, but that doesn't mean the graphics don't look great (even for this year, I haven't even run it with GPU PhysX; my card is a 270X). The game is based on a health bar system, collecting the fuel to replenish it from dead mythicals.

Personally the game felt a lot like FarCry 2, Crysis 2, and Bioshock to me (all in a good sense, I recognise that FC2 and C2 are hated amoung the series, but seriosly give all 4 of them a chance). When it comes to public reviews (Gamespot, IGN, etc.) the only honest reviews (I can find) come from PlayStation Magazine (less so, a little harsh but Sony does force their exclusives onto people of the wrong demographic all the god-damn time), GameInformer (also a little harsh, it's the Unreal Engine (no offense), it can't do  really increadable things  (Antichamber was a greate game, but there are graphic â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ who critisize it)), Gameplanet and Xbox Magazine, these 4 being less intimidated by Gears of War 2 (Impossible from PDM), FarCry 2, Call of Duty WAW and other during it's release.

While I haven't tried the multiplayer mode myself (I have also heard that there aren't many players), the game doesn't really on PvP TDM, but more a single, objective based gametype where you collect the essence from the mythicals, first to fill their collector wins.

I sugest having an Xbox 360 controller for this, being a game that was developed on consoles (I would recomend a controller anyway, it isn't PvP so you won't get beaten by an elite player with a laser/high accuracy/performance mouse).

PS. IGN is still a  really  â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ company/site/place.

reviewText: I know the second you saw this you were confused. Legendary a good game?!?!? But I am being serious here. I loved this game. Everyone says either It is pretty moderate for a shooter" or "Bad game"  which I don't understand at all. I had more fun with this shooter than COD! In COD you fight a bunch of similair stupid â™¥â™¥â™¥ enemies who have no special abilities at all. Or you play an average zombie survival mode. Or you play online agains't a bunch of screaming kids and swearing adults with absolutely no innovation at all even in the sequels it is almost exactly the same. What happens in Legendary? Griffins swoop down picking up enemies in their mouths and eating them. Werewolfs lunge at you and throw objects at you and when they are killed you have to chop of their heads or they recuperate. Fire drakes shoot fire out of their mouths at you but can be taken care of by activating a sprinkler or shooting a fire extinguisher. And while you are doing this a MASSIVE golem above is smashing through buildings and stepping on fleeing people. Also a giant tentacled beast is grabbing allies and pulling them to a watery grave. And guess what. Those tentacles can also grab you and the golem can also step on you. All these mythical creatures from different cultures are trying to kill you while you are trying to destroy a golem by activating 3 EMPs to seperate the energy of the golem from the body. Explosive spiders from Japan
date: Fire Drakes from old tales and a Kraken from common folklore. My favourite creature is the Nari. A creepy bat like creature with a childs face who can become a ghost and              a physical creature. They often possess objects and throw them at you and generally make life a pain. They steal objects needed for objectives and force you to chase them down often leading you to traps. One time a Nari stole a valve I needed to proceed and dropped it in a suspicious looking chamber. When I entered the doors closed and a fan possessed by the Nari  started sucking me towards it. Only by shooting the supports could I barely escape and when I did I was attacked by a tentacle and almost pulled towards my doom. And that is only level 2. The only bad thing I would say about this game is the graphics however because of the graphics it works on less powerful computers like mine. Some of the most popular games also have bad graphics like HL2 and Killing Floor but noone complains about that. All in all I would give it an 8/10. Definitely worth playing and fun."

All around one time play through value and that's it.

reviewText:
I bought this game for around 70 cents, so I'm going to give it a thumbs up.

Do you like mythology? Do you like mythological creatures?

Well I sure hope you do, because this game is literally throwing all sorts of mythos at you with no legitimate reason at all. Sure, Pandora's Box opened and is unleashing hell on New York, but who really cares? Well obviously you do since you were branded by Pandora's Box and now have the power to absorb the creature's life force. Jewish mythos? There. Greek mythos? Obviously. Irish mythos? Why not! Heck it even has the mythological creature of obscure cultrures. Thanks, Legendary.

Why did all of this happen? What did New York do?

Well okay, you're some sort of person who does dangerous and odd jobs. For example, mowing the lawn for that old lady who lives on the incredibly steep hillside. Your back's gonna need some time to recover from all that leaning. But really, this old rich dude is obviously the spokesperson of white capitalism and asks you to insert a key into Pandora's Box. Because unleashing hell for about $10,000 is a good investment, right? Of course it is, Deckard.

All in all, I give this game a 7/10. The gameplay is dull, the voice acting is alright I guess, and the graphics aren't anything to write home about. Though the real seller for this game is the fact that those GRIFFONS LOOK SO MENACING AND COOL LIKE HOLY COW I WANNA HAVE THAT GRIFFON'S MYTHOLOGICAL HUMAN-EAGLE-LION BABIES. And â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, it was 99 cents. Not really, it was like 70-something.

reviewText:
For the price this is an excellent deal. It's a fun FPS that pits you against all manner of mythological beasties. From Griffons to Krakens. The graphics are nice, though somewhat dated. It's a fun game, and sometimes you can get it for next to nothing. I got mine, on sale for under a buck. It was 75 cents i I recall correctly.

Like I said, it's worth the cost, and you should get it...especially if it's on sale! However it does have flaws! First, for a game from '08, it seems to have some performance issues. I mean, I can play Alien Isolation flawlessly, I should be able to play this, yet I found it having on occasion poor framerates.

The controls are also clunky, and take some serious getting used to.

reviewText: I don't know if I'd call this a recommendation" but this games wasn't as bad as I'd heard. I was always into mythology when I was a kid so the concept was fascinating to me.  The good parts are the story
date: which isn't bad and there are a nice variety of levels to play around in. It's short which means I can finish it and move on (which I did) The bad parts is a lot of everything else. The game is extremely linear until you come across an environmental puzzle and your next move isn't always clear. The guns feel extremely underpowered (it's actually better to use an axe in the early part of the game). And the worst sin of all: Hold [E] to bypass and/or turn.  There are so many valves to turn and control panels to bypass you could easily have taken another hour of play time off.  Overall did I hate it? No. But if you can get this game for a buck
recommended: which I think it has been

reviewText:
This cost me under 50p. ( <$0.70 )
I was expecting to play for a few minutes and have a laugh at a 50/100 game.
I waited and waited for the point where I would get bored.
Several hours later I'm shooting rockets down a kraken's throat in the centre of London, fighting off gryphons and strafing attack helicopters.
Then the game ended.
And I was left waiting.

It's short, simple, there's not much to it.

Only one game breaking bug.

Worth it for the price.

Bought this for about a dollar, and it was worth every penny....and not a penny more.  The opening set piece is really well done, and the premise is cool but the execution is pretty bad. Script/story/character animations/enemy AI. All pretty bad.  There's maybe...7 different monsters enemies you encounter total.

Final Level - You have to edit some .ini files to enable clipping in order to ghost up the elevator shaft otherwise you fall through the floor until you die.

You can't get out of the end-credits unless you Alt+F4.

Yup, about a dollar.

reviewText: This is actually a very good game. It has good visuals, good music, and good gameplay. The pacing is alright and the bosses are fun. The one thing which stood out to me was that they did a great job with the weapons. They all seem relevant, even the melee weapon which I used up til the last level. The story, while not fabulously original, was told and executed very well. Overall, if the game isn't quite legendary, it's a fun play and worth the very reasonable price tag.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I feel like this game's store page gives the wrong impression. With the solid 5/10 meta score and the low price of $5 it's easy to assume this game isn't worth your time but it definitely deserves a look. By no means is it a blockbuster triple A title but what it is is a short fun FPS with innovative ideas and an intriguing story. Don't buy it if the slightest bit of repetitive gameplay annoys you or else the limited different types of enemies and needing to hold E for every door might get you down but if you're out of a game to play and like a little First Person action then pick this up. If it goes on sale then you have no excuse not to!\n\nIn short - Buy it and love it for what it is, a short fun FPS to fill in the gaps.

reviewText:
6/10 GOOD GAME BUT EASILY FORGETTABLE

Legendary was released in 2008 during a time where the FPS genre was ran by the likes of call of duty,bioshock.halo,fear,red faction and games of the like so naturally the gameplay isnt too far off
from those. it lacks variety and depth both in story and gameplay but on the flip side the visuals and
frame rate are pretty amazing for their time. the game had clunky irresponisve controls which didnt
make a big difference alot of the time but there were times (like during the minotar and griffin fights)
were snappier controls would have been helpful but werent there so movements and actions had
to be pre planned and not done on the fly. overall this game is definitly worth a playthough with a few
things in mind:
- dont take it too seriously
- dont try and compare it to modern games
- put it on easy,kick your feet up and enjoy the
games nice visuals and loose story.

reviewText:
Don't expect a tripleA title when purchasing this game. But in fact, it's not that bad as long as you don't compare it to other, major FPS franchises.

The storyline is interesting, diverse maps, many different enemys that require a unique approach, Weapons feel ok.

As a time waster it's pretty tolerable, and in fact it does nothing especially good, but also there are no major cons...

If you look for a cheap and average FPS-experience where you don't have to think much, this is the game for you.

For all others: Better avoid it, it isn't a masterpiece and the game doesn't show anything new or does something particularly good, but it's a solid apocalypse-themed FPS with ok-ish graphics and average, CoD-like singleplayer gameplay.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Wow, an underated game wich I didn't expect much... it did blow my head off.

The Bad:
Gameplay is uncofortable, not the worst but could be a lot better.
No aiming skill required you shoot stright even jumping or sprinting.
Normal jump is useless and sprint jump uncontrollable (it jumps very, very fast and far away)
Not many guns.
Human enemies are lame and the AI is very basic.

The Good:
All the rest!!!
Great storyline
Epic in game situations
Impressive background, ambience art work
Music match very good the game
All monsters in game are AWESOME
Also for each monster it is updated in game pda with actual information about it's myth (very cultural, I like to learn through an action game)
Graphics are very detailed, of course is not Crysis 1... but appealing to the eye, nice destruction effects.

I totally recommend this game for it's epic situations and storyline, perhaps not the 5 dollars but stay alert for any offer on this game.

PD: For those consuming only graphics and CoD look another game. This one has a story and reading.
PD2: I read many bad reviews for this game, and all only stick to gameplay (yes is not good, but not terrible) or graphics, the storyline and epic moments are worth the game.

reviewText:
Is a good game considering its current price... grab it for a decent old school FPS

Pros

+Super cheap
+Some pretty impresive scripted scenes...
+Solid gameplay, overall is a solid FPS
+Superhuman speed/jumps when sprinting
+On Hard mode is a nice challenge
+Looks old..but not bad

Cons

-Enemy variety is not the greatest
-Your only power is heal
-People around you that fight by your side only exist to be killed brutally... It's far too common and lose impact quickly
-The checkpoints can be merciless (on hard)

reviewText:
For the price this is an excellent deal. It's a fun FPS that pits you against all manner of mythological beasties. From Griffons to Krakens. The graphics are nice, though somewhat dated. It's a fun game, and sometimes you can get it for next to nothing. I got mine, on sale for under a buck. It was 75 cents i I recall correctly.

Like I said, it's worth the cost, and you should get it...especially if it's on sale! However it does have flaws! First, for a game from '08, it seems to have some performance issues. I mean, I can play Alien Isolation flawlessly, I should be able to play this, yet I found it having on occasion poor framerates.

The controls are also clunky, and take some serious getting used to.

reviewText:
This game is worth $5... no more... no less.
5 hours of game play.
50 minutes of headaches.
5 minutes of bad cut scenes
5 mins of editing INI files.
50 secounds of fun with the flamethrower.

This isn't a bad game. It's not a good game. It's a game. Interesting plot/story in so far as the mythology is concerned. TERRIBLE voice acting. Truly the actors either didn't care or were directed badly. Either way it's not good.

The save check point is annoying but not terrible since it saves your weapons and reloads all your ammo.
The power yes... one. Could have been interested or at least had upgrades but no...

All in all it's a fun distraction and if you're looking for an average FPS where you are the Hero and saviour of mankind then yes this game is for you.

One thing though... there is a nasty clipping bug for the final level where you fall through the last elevator... horrifying that this wasn't addressed by the developer.

No patch just some advice involving INI files.

Here is the solution that worked for me. Best of luck fellow gamer.

Here is a fix that works for most people.

Open the PandoraEngine.ini (on vista it is on C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config-Folder) and search for
MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300" and change the value to 60. So the game runs at maximum 60 fps. Play through to next check point save then edit it back to 300 and continue game.

If a setting of 60 does not work try 30.

Game will not run so good but it's only a short run to the next checkpoint where you can then reset back to 300 and trust me you will want to.

GG."

reviewText: Buy this when it is incredibly cheap becasue it is not worth a dollar. The alpha werewolf is wht a werewolf should be. The Nari have no sense of self-preservation. The kraken should not be able to fit in a river. What the heck are echidna tentacles, All the enmy soldiers reminded of captain hook when I first saw them. Buy this game for a dollar, play it until you've seen the kraken, and then be done with it.

reviewText:
So i buyed it a year ago and just played it for 20 minutes then, but yesterday i started the game again and today i just finished it.
The game took about 6 hours to me and i think it would have a total of 8 hours if you search for every email.
It's just a normal linear-FPS, but i actually liked the Story (i don't gonna spoil now).
For a 2008 game the graphics is alright, but i`ve laughed at the animations (The walking-animation of Vivian? My god, i laughed so hard on this) and for sure the mouse speed, that was hella to fast for me, the option was on 0 and it was even to fast, but hey, i like slow mouses ;)

I actually encounterd a glitch near the end, you get into an elevator, vivian speaks to you and the elevator starts and then you fall down.
Sloution? On windows 7 go to library->documents->my games->Legendary->PandoraGame->Config
Open the .txt File called PandoraEngine and search for MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300 and change 300 to 60 or 30. If it doesn't work try to change bSmoothFrameRate=TRUE to FALSE, hope it helps you :)

So at all it's a good game for some hours and for 2.99â‚¬ or now with sale on .74 pens, you should buy and play it :)

reviewText:
Don't expect a tripleA title when purchasing this game. But in fact, it's not that bad as long as you don't compare it to other, major FPS franchises.

The storyline is interesting, diverse maps, many different enemys that require a unique approach, Weapons feel ok.

As a time waster it's pretty tolerable, and in fact it does nothing especially good, but also there are no major cons...

If you look for a cheap and average FPS-experience where you don't have to think much, this is the game for you.

For all others: Better avoid it, it isn't a masterpiece and the game doesn't show anything new or does something particularly good, but it's a solid apocalypse-themed FPS with ok-ish graphics and average, CoD-like singleplayer gameplay.

reviewText:
This game is Legandary... If we're talking about simplistic, and slow. You wont find much to differ this game from other shooters besides the painstakingly broken healing, and easy enemies. If you're not being 1 hit killed by some random annoying thing, it's the pace killing puzzle sequences, like some kind of poor-man's Half-Life 2. Often does this game feel as if it doesn't know exactly what it is... Are you a shooter?, dark fantasy set with greek mythological themes?, or a plot driven set-piece affair? I really wish I could love this game; but that appears to be impossible at this point.

Towards the beginning I was struggling with only a pistol vs enemies with no discernible weak point. Enemies that spit fire at you from all directions. This was not so bad as it felt challenging... That was until I learned how to heal. From then on, I haven't died a single time to a normal enemy. Only the cheap kills sometimes manage to get me; but beyond that, there were no struggles exhibited from fighting any of the normal enemies. The AI is not so bad; but the healing factor is just too good in this game.

You then reach the later levels of the game, where it suddenly ramps up the difficulty, artificially. The enemies are not more difficult, they just start to spawn in certain places infinitely. It Serves to waste ammo and create tedium, as enemies do not give you even a second to think about your surroundings. The game legitimately tries to have you solve problems while facing off with a never ending onslaught of Werewolves, and Exploding Spiders. This wouldn't be so annoying if you didn't move around like you had a weight strapped to your ankle. The Main Protagonist can neither jump high enough, or move fast enough to evade enemies for very long. It serves to note that his impressive run-jump can't be used in any other direction but forward. Jumping is the same as dodging in a first person shooter, and with this mechanic so severely crippled, it just made it easier to get infuriated as I tapped the force push mechanic.

The force push becomes even more important late game; but they were smart to make this ability also require the power you use to heal, to use it. You'd have 3 or 4 chances at the push move before it was depleted, and enemies are pretty relentless about charging you. The great thing is, you can't use any ability while you reload, which lead to some rather frustrating deaths in heated combat. The limitations, and player limitations totally handicap you into becoming nothing but a walking turret. I've played Wolenstein 3D many times, and love the game; but this game spits on it's legacy with how embarassingly bad it is. It is true that you don't need to be able to jump, or have super quick movement; but you just feel gimped in the face of all the enemies in this game.

reviewText:
9hrs worth of play doesn't seem like a lot, but some times it's about quality rather than quantity. Having said that, Legendary might be considred a short story precursor to later and greater games like, Bioshock.
Legendary's strength lies in it's ability to quickly and thouroughly suck you into the storyline and gameplay. The gameplay is broken up in the time-honoured fashion of action-filled chapters, with storyboard cut-scenes filling in the gaps between locations. Therein lies one reason the game is so short in comparison with something like Deus Ex: Human Revolution, where instead everything is played out in-game; and to be honest, it was refreshing. Upon reflection though, there is A LOT of gameplay there that could have been included, but while actually playing the game, you don't feel as though you're missing out.
I can only think of two negatives that really stuck out, and one of them is kind of subjective I suppose, and that is that one of the epic boss monsters doesn't actually get its own boss fight. If they ever did/do the (obvious-from-the-ending) sequal, that's something that you would hope to see tied up for sure. The other is an immersion-breaking render glitch that requires you to edit the engine .ini to proceed to the final showdown.
I think I paid $5 or so for Legendary, and for the few small things I didn't like, there were nine good hours of content that I loved. Definitely the most enjoyable title I've played this year.

Therein lies one reason the game is so short in comparison with something like Deus Ex: Human Revolution, where instead everything is played out in-game; and to be honest, it was refreshing. Upon reflection though, there is A LOT of gameplay there that could have been included, but while actually playing the game, you don't feel as though you're missing out.
I can only think of two negatives that really stuck out, and one of them is kind of subjective I suppose, and that is that one of the epic boss monsters doesn't actually get its own boss fight. If they ever did/do the (obvious-from-the-ending) sequal, that's something that you would hope to see tied up for sure. The other is an immersion-breaking render glitch that requires you to edit the engine .ini to proceed to the final showdown.
I think I paid $5 or so for Legendary, and for the few small things I didn't like, there were nine good hours of content that I loved. Definitely the most enjoyable title I've played this year.
